title: Practice-Centered Instructional Design Competency Enhancement Program for Public Health Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced Expertise in Public Health and Fundamental Instructional Design Theory
context.additional_context: Strengthening field applicability through project-based learning that simulates real-world work environments.

learning_goals: Learners can develop at least five types of instructional design documents tailored to real-world public health project scenarios
Learners can create and utilize educational materials (infographics, videos, etc.) reflecting the target group’s characteristics (age, job role, education level)
Learners can analyze and resolve practical problems in the instructional design process using five judgment criteria (framing, core, tools, exploration, visual judgment)

resources: Digital production toolkit (Canva, PPT templates, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
